semantic_title: Acute Respiratory Failure as Principal Diagnosis Coding Rules
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 10. Chapter 10: Diseases of the Respiratory System > b. Acute Respiratory Failure > 1. Acute respiratory failure as principal diagnosis

content.full_text: A code from subcategory J96.0, Acute respiratory failure, or subcategory J96.2, Acute and chronic respiratory failure, may be assigned as a principal diagnosis when it is the condition established after study to be chiefly responsible for occasioning the admission to the hospital, and the selection is supported by the Alphabetic Index and Tabular List. However, chapter-specific coding guidelines (such as obstetrics, poisoning, HIV, newborn) that provide sequencing direction take precedence. (Evidence: pg no: 56, L60-L62)
content.summary: Rules for assigning acute respiratory failure as principal diagnosis including conditions and exceptions for chapter-specific guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 56, L60-L62)
key_concepts: Principal diagnosis criteria for respiratory failure (Evidence: pg no: 56, L61)
Subcategories J96.0 and J96.2 usage (Evidence: pg no: 56, L60-L61)
Chapter-specific guideline precedence (Evidence: pg no: 56, L62)
Alphabetic Index and Tabular List support requirement (Evidence: pg no: 56, L61-L62)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Acute respiratory failure may be principal diagnosis when it is the condition chiefly responsible for occasioning the admission (Evidence: pg no: 56, L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: Respiratory failure must meet standard principal diagnosis definition of being the main reason for admission after study (Evidence: pg no: 56, L61)
common_applications: Respiratory failure as main admission reason

detailed_rules.rule_text: Selection must be supported by the Alphabetic Index and Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 56, L61-L62)
detailed_rules.explanation: Code assignment must follow standard ICD-10-CM coding conventions and be supported by official coding resources (Evidence: pg no: 56, L61-L62)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Chapter-specific coding guidelines that provide sequencing direction take precedence (Evidence: pg no: 56, L62)
detailed_rules.explanation: Special chapter guidelines for obstetrics, poisoning, HIV, newborn override general respiratory failure sequencing rules (Evidence: pg no: 56, L62)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify acute respiratory failure diagnosis
Step 2: Determine if respiratory failure is chief reason for admission
Step 3: Check for chapter-specific sequencing guidelines
Step 4: Verify code selection with Alphabetic Index and Tabular List
Step 5: Assign appropriate subcategory code as principal diagnosis
